page.title: 14GASTHORPE VILLAGE
page.content: Gasthorpe is a very small village. At the centre is a telephone box and a small post office. This is surrounded by about twenty cottages dating from c.1500 to the present day. The older cottages are mostly clay with thatched roofs and the newer cottages are brick. The village is extremely quiet and isolated. There are no shops, pubs or services. There is a cricket club on the south side of the village and the clubhouse is used as a social club fortnightly. Weekly events are bus services to Thetford and Bury St. Edmunds, a mobile fish and chip van and a mobile fruit and vegetable van. A mobile library visits monthly. Most residents own cars through necessity. Local shops in neighbouring villages are only patronised in emergencies as people prefer to go to Diss or Thet- ford. Only the people change here.
